messages: f4dfad803df83144a5be86d9bca87678 (11:17): Hi there, I have a serious problem getting back/forward buttons working when the #urlbar is hidden, https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=711105 Can anyone please help?
b92af08a18aff623222629da14873ffd (11:27): wonders whether there's a way to get Bugzilla (or the browser) to gunzip attachments
20354c9320c4d71ea71ef03fc579d1fd (11:38): I'd rather know how to make Bugzilla stop sending diffs >:-|
20354c9320c4d71ea71ef03fc579d1fd (11:39): I don't want them in my mail
20354c9320c4d71ea71ef03fc579d1fd (11:39): that's just a waste of traffic
715eef369bb5980524a008321a92f826 (12:03): why is window.crypto.random not available in firefox but webkit based browsers?
03cd618659ad3063c1d53077657a801c (12:10): 715eef369bb5980524a008321a92f826: IIRC the patch is waiting for reviews
60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28 (12:25): hi there; is there a known build issue with m-c? On Win7, a "make -f client.mk clean" after a fresh checkout runs into an infinite loop
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:42): f0719ea8e993ccca9ffca5334b96f546: do you get bug comment email for https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=711105 even though you aren't CC'ed?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:43): f0719ea8e993ccca9ffca5334b96f546: ok. I hear that bug is a blocker for a Firefox-based product (Web converger)
60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28 (12:56): so is anybody able to build from a fresh checkout (on Win7?)
5c00c96ec811bdcfbf010d89ed9779bc (12:56): replaces macros by templates in xpcom string classes (narrow vs wide chars)
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (12:56): On Win7? No... But that's because I don't have a build env set up
60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28 (12:57): well, I'm not sure it's w7 related
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (12:57): Yeah, I know a bit about the horrible setup we use
d9937775cc729ee85cdcc70da7dad6b1 (12:58): shall I update and try?
4c1c270666933dbd47ce3ac089c0d63a (13:08): any ircop here for banning spammer ALEXIA?

d9937775cc729ee85cdcc70da7dad6b1 (13:13): 81fa1e07c4ea96f215901d989f8bf37b: could you help me a bit with these results? https://tbpl.mozilla.org/?tree=Try&rev=d5ab56ba2b18 I'm not sure which one of those failures are known and if there are any that could be caused by my patch...
81fa1e07c4ea96f215901d989f8bf37b (13:17): d9937775cc729ee85cdcc70da7dad6b1: I believe those are all known intermittent failures
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (13:17): Starred all of them, except Android
81fa1e07c4ea96f215901d989f8bf37b (13:19): so nobody except philor will notice if you add new failures
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (13:19): darktrojan noticed a new permaorange, IIRC
d9937775cc729ee85cdcc70da7dad6b1 (13:21): 81fa1e07c4ea96f215901d989f8bf37b: 8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81: so do you guys think that this patch is ready to be pushed? or shall I find philor first?
d9937775cc729ee85cdcc70da7dad6b1 (13:21): not that I could push the patch anywhere on my own...

d9937775cc729ee85cdcc70da7dad6b1 (13:23): 81fa1e07c4ea96f215901d989f8bf37b: I also added quite some tests to it, do you mind taking a look at them some time if I'm doing the right thing? you know the conversion from mochi test to xpcshell test for the windowless version of indexeddb...
d9937775cc729ee85cdcc70da7dad6b1 (13:24): the mochi tests should be the very same as before, except now there will be some xpcshell tests too, so it should not hurt anyone...

d9937775cc729ee85cdcc70da7dad6b1 (13:28): 81fa1e07c4ea96f215901d989f8bf37b: I think the most interesting part is head_idb, the rest of the changes are quite trivial... there are some more tests to be changed but this patch is already way to big to add anything to it...
81fa1e07c4ea96f215901d989f8bf37b (13:29): d9937775cc729ee85cdcc70da7dad6b1: it looks like maybe you lost some files?
81fa1e07c4ea96f215901d989f8bf37b (13:30): d9937775cc729ee85cdcc70da7dad6b1: I don't see a test_add_put.js for instance
d9937775cc729ee85cdcc70da7dad6b1 (13:34): I forgot to add some files indeed in the end it seems
81fa1e07c4ea96f215901d989f8bf37b (13:37): d9937775cc729ee85cdcc70da7dad6b1: it looks fine to me, other than the whole losing files thing ;-)
d9937775cc729ee85cdcc70da7dad6b1 (13:39): is busy adding the missing files and hoping that one day will get his try server access
81fa1e07c4ea96f215901d989f8bf37b (13:41): idly wonders which coast dbaron is on this week
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (13:42): d9937775cc729ee85cdcc70da7dad6b1, what happened to your access bug?
81fa1e07c4ea96f215901d989f8bf37b (13:42): I think it got caught in the "Erica isn't receiving my emails" trap, and then on the "Marcia is on vacation" trap
